alert.note: Alert for South Washington Coast (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued December 26 at 12:49PM PST until December 28 at 12:00AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT FOR DANGEROUS SURF NOW IN EFFECT FOR TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING FOR BEACHES... * WHAT...Heavy surf, along with sneaker waves. Seas of 13 to 18 feet will maintain a choppy and chaotic surf zone through Wednesday evening. In addition, expect frequent sneaker waves. * WHERE...Beaches of south Washington, north and west-central Oregon. * WHEN...Tuesday afternoon through Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...Destructive waves may wash over beaches, jetties, and other structures unexpectedly. People near or in the surf zone can be swept off rocks and jetties, with life-threatening injury or even drowning afterwards. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...High seas are expected to arrive later Wednesday night into Thursday, maintaining the chaotic and dangerous surf zone.
info.instruction: Avoid climbing on rocks in and near the surf zone. Never turn your back to the sea, as could lose awareness of the waves.
